Race.SpecificTitle: PW School District No. 100 Prop. No. 1 -- 10 Mills - SB - 20 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide School District No. 100 Propositions
Proposition No. 1
(Millage)
Race.FullText: Shall parishwide School District No. 100 of the Parish of Tangipahoa, State of Louisiana (the "District") be authorized to levy a special tax of ten (10) mills on all property subject to taxation in the District (an estimated $5,646,350 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of twenty (20) years, beginning with the year 2018 and ending with the year 2037, for the purpose of giving additional support for the payment of teacher and support employees' salaries and benefits?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW School District No. 100 Prop. No. 2 -- 4 Mills - SB - 20 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide School District No. 100 Propositions
Proposition No. 2
(Millage)
Race.FullText: Shall parishwide School District No. 100 of the Parish of Tangipahoa, State of Louisiana (the "District'') be authorized to levy a special tax of four (4) mills on all property subject to taxation in the District (an estimated $2,258,540 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of twenty (20) years, beginning with the year 2018 and ending with the year 2037, for the purpose of giving additional support for the maintenance of school facilities?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW School District No. 100 Prop. No. 3 -- 6 Mills - SB - 20 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide School District No. 100 Propositions
Proposition No. 3
(Millage)
Race.FullText: Shall parishwide School District No. 100 of the Parish of Tangipahoa, State of Louisiana (the "District'') be authorized to levy a special tax of six (6) mills on all property subject to taxation in the District (an estimated $3,387,810 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of twenty (20) years, beginning with the year 2018 and ending with the year 2037, for the purpose of giving additional support for the constructing of, new or improving, renovating and/or remodeling existing classrooms and related facilities, in order to reduce the number of modular buildings?

Race.SpecificTitle: Hammond Area Econ. & Indus. Dev. Dist. -- 2% Tax - BOC - Perpetuity
Race.SummaryText:
Hammond Area Economic and Industrial Development District Proposition
(Hotel Tax)
Race.FullText: Shall the Hammond Area Economic and Industrial Development District (the "District"), under the provisions of Sections 130.611 through 130.619 of Title 33 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950 (the "Act"), and other constitutional and statutory authority, be authorized to levy and collect a tax of two percent (2%) (the "Tax"), in perpetuity, beginning January 1, 2018, upon the paid occupancy of hotel rooms, the term "hotel" having the meaning set forth in La. R.S. 33:4574.1.1.C(1), within the District (the Tax to be in addition to any other taxes thereon) (an estimated $347,993 expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), with the proceeds of the Tax (after paying reasonable and necessary costs and expenses of collecting and administering the Tax) to be used for the purposes set forth in the Act, including economic and industrial development?
